reviews.review_text: Staff are always attentive and willing to help. Jason, one of the Dr. Lams office assistants has helped me immensely. All the family physicians are very qualified at this clinic. There are a lot of admin support at this clinic for all the physicians working here so they can focus on their clinical work with patients. I highly recommend this clinic if you are in need of a family physician.

When my amazing GP decided to end her practice, I was thinking that it would be a very difficult transition in finding a doctor that would accept new patients but she recommended Forward Care Medical Clinic to me and I was accepted quickly and easily. The receptionist service level is very professional in my opinion. They have a lot of patients calling in and patients walking in and they handle themselves very well. No abrupt attitude given to anyone everytime I was there. The doctor who sees me is named Andrew Chiu, hes very professional, gives great advice, tells it how it is, no sugar coating. The great thing about FCM is if your regular doctor is not available to treat you, any one doctor on site is capable of treating you as they have your records immediately available to see your history. I needed to see my doctor one day during this Covid time and my usual location in Oakridge Mall was booked all day, they said if its really of great importance and I couldnt wait a day I could go to their other location on 41st Avenue and they could see me within the hour. Thats just super convenient. Totally prefer this than going to a walk in clinic. I definitely would recommend Forward Care Medical Clinic to anyone looking for a new GP. 5 stars!!!

While I was reading reviews from others, I disagree with their experience. I found the front desk staff professional and friendly in their dealings with me. They are of course very busy, 3 front desk staff handling appointments for 8 doctors. My doctor is Dr. Lam and she is the most friendly doctor I met in the my past 70+ years. She does not chit chat much but she is caring and professional.

Great location. Definitely a busy medical office but super glad the family and I have a family doctor here. Front desk staff are organized. Sometimes the doctor does run late but its very reasonable given the amount of patients. Since COVID, theyve done a great job of not having too many people in the waiting area the times weve been. Overall very happy.

Great doctors.  Our family has been well taken care of by the doctors from cancer to migraine to childbirth.  I have seen a lot of complaints with the receptionists here.  I think most of them are pretty nice.  Some sounded a bit more blunt when they are speaking in English because of some cultural differences in my opinion. For those of you who couldn t sign up along with your family members, talk to your family doctors regarding the situation, they have the authority to override the administrative staff and put you into their system.  (The administrative staff sometimes just follows the procedure mechanically)

Dr. Cindy Huang is my GP at this location and shes awesome. Very proactive in terms of annual testing and always on top of follow ups. The reception area always seems stressed but never misses anything.

My family doctor, Dr. Janice Wong, she is so professional, caring and knowledgeable.  She treats her patients like a good friend and really cares about her patients.  Im glad that I can have Dr. Wong as my family doctor.  I feel Im well taken care of.

Dr. Chang  is as fine a person as one could want for a family doctor. She is kind, caring, and courteous.  She has always given her time graciously, and has been helpful to our family for many years. The receptionists are always helpful, polite and nice to us.

Ive always had prompt service unlike other medical clinics. I never had to wait for more than 5-10 min past my appointment time. The doctors weve seen so far are all friendly and addressed our concerns beyond our expectations. I highly recommend this clinic!!
Dr Andrew Chiu and Dr Evelyn Wu are excellent, professional, helpful and caring.

Dr Andrew Chiu is an excellent doctor. He is professional, patient, a good listener and friendly. Grateful to have Dr Chiu as my doctor and Forward Medical Care as my clinic. Other positives is the location (Oakridge skytrain) and ability to book appointments online. Thanks

I am happy with the knowledge and professionalism this office possesses in their overall operation. The doctors are on top of their work and actually care about your wellbeing. It has been five years since I started with the clinic and I am not looking to change any time in the future.

I have been the patient of the clinic for few years after my last family doctor retired.  Forward Care Medical Clinic really care about their patients and doing good follow up and recommendation.  I would highly recommend who ever doesnt have a family doctor to visit this clinic to apply a family doctor for their health care.
I have found Dr Sung Mi Song to be both caring and thorough. Also my experience with support staff and receptionist have always been positive.

Our family doctor is Dr. Andrew and he is very considerate, humble and accommodating. I bombard him with questions/ information but he always listens intently and he is definitely not rude unlike my previous    .

I have been a patient of Dr. Amanda Laus at Forward Care Medical Clinic Oakridge since 2013. The care Ive received from Dr. Lau, other doctors at FCM, and their support staff has been wonderful. They are attentive and really take the word care to heart.
My doctor, Marco Lau, was a referral from my retired doctor, and I could not be happier!  He is knowledgeable, quick to respond, and never makes me feel like I should rush out of his office.
Dr Wu is great. The end.

Dr. Sarah Bromilow and Olia really care for their clients.  Unfortunately I needed an emergency appointment and they took time out of their busy day to fit me in.  I cant express how grateful I am for their care.
Theyre always so quick and so kind. Dr. Chiu is incredibly thoughtful and thorough, Ive had countless appointments here and always been very happy with them.
Both Dr. Chiu & the doctor who is temporarily filling in for him (cant remember her name) are great!
I highly recommend Forward Care Medical Clinic specially Dr Sarah Bromilow, she is a great doctor who cares about her patient
Its very professional and the doctors/ staff are attentive and kind

I ve been going to this busy clinic for several years. The doctors are pleasant and have good bedside manner. For urgent appointments, I ve been fit in to an appointment same day or next day with my primary physician or another on duty physician that day. The front staff team is efficient. The clinic is quite busy most days, even during the pandemic, so expect a short wait before seeing your doctor.

Doctors are excellent. Very efficient on both regular and virtual appointments. Front desk staff are alright, their manners could be more professional and more pleasant. Some of them still need additional training on telephone etiquettes and organisational skills such as informing patients about information of the referral Dr., location, time and date in a sequence instead of jumping back and forth with the info.

I follow my GP wherever she goes, thats how I started coming to FCM, so as my family members. I dont find the front desk staff extremely friendly, but it seems to be busy at the front all the time and I dont have any high expectation for front desk, to be honest. All I care is our GP - shes wonderful, compassionate, caring and very knowledgeable.

This is a busy practice, but Ive never had too much trouble getting an appointment with my family doctor. Itd be nice if they had online booking or did prescription refills over the phone, but I understand as someone who manages systems for businesses that its no small task to get such a thing setup. I always have a good experience.

FCM team at both locations are great. I like how Doctors take the time to listen to your issues. The front of house is always super busy but they always manage to get things done. They have been awesome at quickly adapting to ensure the safety of the patients during the COVID pandemic.

I like there is an option to book online. However I wish there are more flexible appointment times especially for people who does not have many sick days and can only visit the doctor outside work time.
My doctor is pretty good. And hes helped me out within my expectations.
Nice doctors!

Long time patient of this clinic and the doctors here, but this one incident involving their reception staff was just appalling. Your reception staff must disclose to all patients that there is a $50 no show fee even for phone call appointments. To force someone to pay this fee after a phone call was missed for legitimate reasons ESPECIALLY when it was not disclosed upon booking is borderline robbing. Please reconsider your policy surrounding phone vs. in-person appointments and/or re-train reception staff to be more considerate of patients circumstances. It seems they can greatly benefit from a lesson in using discretion. Not every patient visits the clinic frequently enough to see the notices for themselves. It is the job of the front desk receptionists to make policies transparent. Such a shame to have encountered hostility from your staff after so so many years of being a patient (my entire life so far to be exact...). To expect us to constantly bend our equally busy schedules to fit into the odd schedules of all the doctors here is impractical and a quick way to lose patients. I am starting to think I am better off finding a different practice to seek health care. The current front desk team is truly mediocre at their job at best. Edit: reply received and read. Unfortunately it missed to address the point about reception staff failing to disclose such an apparently important policy. Still not willing to admit wrongdoing?
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello Kimberly, We are very sorry for your experience. When our patients book appointments, we expect them to be committed to the time they booked. If our patients are unable to make it to the time they booked, they are welcome to call in and adjust their appointment 24 hours before their booked time. If our patients have an emergency or a legitimate reason, we usually waive the no show fee and end with a warning. Phone appointments are just as important as in-person appointments, which is why there is a no show fee for phone calls as well. If you still have any questions or concerns, please email us at info@forwardcaremedical.com and we will assist you the best of our abilities. Thank you, FCM

reviews.review_text: 5 stars for my GP. None for the front staff. Just like the other reviews, front desk is dismissive but friendly at best. Most of the time just dismissive though. Fees are also ridiculously high. However, my GP is one of the most friendly/skilled people on the planet and its a shame I cant give him 5 stars out of pocket. Waiting area is cramped and sometimes you wait outside if its really full.

Have been a customer for a few years but a little frustrated: This practice is extremely busy and has probably taken on too many doctors and patients , with an administrative pool now unable to cope and provide adequate service: - Phone lines are constantly busy . - Phone mailboxes often full and caller can not leave message. - Nil response and coverage or help on weekends. - Poor English language skills of several receptionist / secretary. Some are hard to understand. - Slow and unnecessarily complicated referral system to get specialists. - can never speak or communicate to doctor , only to the overloaded and slow response office. People , doctors and staff are nice , but none seems able to change or improve the system and seem disempowered. Anders Nordin

Dr Sung mi Song is very rude and unprepared doctor.  Most time  I visited her she had wrong information about my medical records and it made me feel she was not prepared before meeting her patient. It seemed it didn t bother her at all. During the meeting, she used to talk to me in an unpleasant way that she seemed she was very annoyed by me not understanding what she said. She probably thought I was a stupid. As a patient I was very discouraged to ask questions and I didn t feel like to keep conversation with her. There WERE times She didn t called me on time, or met me when in-person meeting(which I understood since she could be busy). But she was very impatient and even aggressive when I couldn t received her call on time when I was really sick. She called  7 times in a row  in total to me and my husband which I think is not necessary (she probably want us to receive the call so that she can yell) and said, we d better find another dr if we keep doing this. It sounded almost like a threat. I wish I could recorded the phone call I had with her. If you have a baby, don t take them to her since she seems she doesn t know how to treat with a little one. My baby was literally freaked out whenever getting a shot from her. It was horrible experiences as a parent, but since it s hard to find a dr so I kinda made compromise to keep her as my dr. Now I regret myself being too patient with her and didn t find another dr more earlier. Hopefully nobody had or will have experiences like me. Not sure if anyone from the clinic is willing to talk to me but I want to let dr. Song to know that patients are not stupid, and not her emotional trashcan.

I love Dr Li, endocrinologist. She is young, kind and very thorough when it comes to patient care. However, her receptionist is very not thoughtful about patient care. Since my mom doesnt speak English, I volunteered to translate and do phone appointment.  She refused to make an conference call appointment at first without asking Dr.Li since she is not familiar with it. I had to ask her to ask Dr Li and convince her for 10min before she asked the Dr. Dr. Li also forgot to order some blood work before CT scan and I called the receptionist to get requisition  And she suggested to call our family doctor instead. Very unkind. Very disrespectful.
Doesnt accept new patients completely pointless clinic its supposed to be for walk-ins for the public not for five people you chose.......... Absolutely ridiculous.

Started to see Dr Amanda Lau before they expanded from a 2 doctors office. Too business type of services instead of a caring practice. No more than  2 questions allowed to ask  even if you have not seen them for so long! The office is so crowded like a zoo!  I was put on hold with that terrible ding ding music every single call & you will be told that the next appointment will be a week later! I feel sorry for those sick elderly patients if they need quick assistance! Even worst is when the elderly dont even know how to book the appointment online! Terrible office management with too many doctors working for Dr Amanda Lau, the boss, who only works 2 days a week, few hours a day. Expecting the patients to accommodate her schedules so I requested to switch to one of her staff doctors but no spaces were reserved for us, the loyal patients! I will never come back to this office again!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello, we are very sorry about your experience. Unfortunately, we can only limit our patients to one or two concerns per appointment as there is a time restraint. If we allow our patients to go over the 10 minute limit, other patients would not be able to have their appointment on time. We do however encourage our patients to book multiple appointments if they have more concerns to discuss with our doctors. If our patients require quick assistance, we do sometimes allow urgent same-day bookings. If you have any questions or concerns, please email us at info@forwardcaremedical.com and we will help you in the best way we can. Thank you, FCM

reviews.review_text: My Doctor Evelyn Wu, Shes wonderful and really cares about her patients. But I will going back to walk in clinics again and hopefully find a new location will the front has manners. A reception here will argue only to prove youre wrong probably just to feel good instead of trying to find a solution.

Who is the horrible woman who called me from the waiting room and took me into the  examination room at 2.30 pm on October 16, 2020? She was rude, aggressive, snapped at me, ordered me uncross my legs, screamed at me to take my shoes off and was generally unbelievably unpleasant. She was dressed in blue and I had a very difficult time understanding her. as her English is terrible. Whoever this person is, would someone in the office tell her that she needs to improve her manners. Patients are not cattle to be ordered around by this very unpleasant person. On the plus side, the receptionist was very nice and Dr. Song is great.

I ve been coming to this clinic when Dr Chan was the only doctor here. She then opened forward care medical with only 3 doctors in the office including herself. When she retired she passed her client list over to another Dr who is still in the office to this day. She was my family doctor until I decided I wanted to switch to a new doctor within the same office. I found out recently that she has left forward care medical. And as a clinic that prides themselves of taking care of their patients. They did not pass her clients on to any other doctor. I called today to talk to reception to ask if I can see any other doctor in the office or even go back to the old doctor. This man said and I quote  you can not cause tech you re no longer our patient or part of our clinic anymore since you were dr - patient I understand there s a shortage of family doctors in bc and everyone wants and needs a family doctor. But this is truely heartbreaking to be with forwardcare medical from the ground up and for them to leave you with no doctor and no care. To give you an idea I ve been with them for 25 years. I want people to know that this is not a clinic worth coming to.

I walked in to Forward Care Medical Clinic and asked if they were accepting new applications. The receptionist said yes and gave me the application form. I filled and gave to them. They said they would call for the first appointment WHICH they never did. I call to followed up and I was told by the rudest receptionist that Dr. Sung is not accepting new patients. I request to talk to another person as she was extremely rude to me. The next person was the same, told me I was in the waiting list and hang up. I cannot believe a medical office treat people like that. What a shame!

If you have an option, I want to warn you about Dr. Sung-Mi Song. I had an appointment with her since she was taking new patients. Unfortunately I missed that appointment and the receptionist called me leaving a message telling me that because Ive missed that first appointment, I need to pay $30 for missing it but I can reschedule the appointment. I said, thats fine, Ill pay the $30 and rescheduled the new appointment. On the day of the appointment, the receptionist called me and told me that Dr.Song now rejects me as a patient because I had missed my first appointment. I asked the receptionist, is this regular protocol? If so, why did you initially tell me that I had to pay a $30 fee and offered to reschedule? And what about the fact that I took time off work so that I could get to this appointment? Are you going to compensate me for work that I had to rearrange for this appointment? The receptionist sounded scared and just said I just do what the doctor tells me and wanted to hang up. And that was it. I havent seen Dr. Song as a patient, but I wanted to let the next patient know that if you do see Dr. Song, consider that she might change her mind last minute, remorselessly.

I give review based on only receptionist that was very rude. I called to get result of my mammogram. I was on hold for about an hour then she picks up the phone and tells me doctor notes says he needs to see me to discuss the result of my mammogram, so I need referral to see this doctor. It was a new doctor, the one referred me was on maternity  leave so I asked the right spelling of his name so I could ask my family doctor for referral and first she refused to give me saying doctor only gave me this instruction to tel you this! Then I repeated could you please spell the name! And she was so fast and inpatient and not clear so I ask again and she didn t want to help! Very sad for people who are in needs of urgent medical procedure and has to deal with such people!

Receptionists are rude and unprofessional most of the time. They might provide inconsistent information which cause confusion to patients. its a business rather than a medical clinic which provide help and advise to patient. I would not recommend this clinic at all.

I love my GP but this office have the worse receptionists working at the front desk!  They are not friendly on the phone and there is never a time when I phone to make an appointment that I wasnt put on hold for a good 5mins.  The receptionists are also not friendly in person.  I never get in on time as there is always a minimum of 30 minutes of wait time but they penalize the patient for being late.

I called to try to make an appointment and they told me they do not attend people who are not patients. I have been with a dry cough and sore throat for a week now and every walk-in clinic says the same. Whats the point of being a doctor if you are not going to help people?! Whats the point of being a clinic if you will not receive people?!

Completely abandoned after one of their doctors (Chan) retired. No succession planning or referrals for any of her patients, just completely left out in the cold. Many loyal patients of decades have to scramble to find new doctors, and to add insult to injury for the added privilege of abandoning their patients they charge $50 to have your files transferred over to a new doctor. I hope this racketeering nonsense of a medical clinic gets shut down for malpractice - its the very least they deserve.

worse admin staff ever.  calling 30 mins before appt to cancel isnt acceptable. the receptionist  said she tried calling a few days ago but no one picked up - I said she should have left a voicemail. thats how messages work!  what about work number? what about email? right. no email. because  they are still in the dark ages. grr.

Dr. Forson Chan is a doctor without compassion and morality. He turned me away from the walk in clinic and refused to treat me for my health issue. I guess he has forgotten his Hippocratic Oath. He suggested I get on a bus, in a pandemic, and travel to another city to see a doctor where I used to live.

Very rude and unhelpful receptionist. Kept telling me that I had not seen my doctor before even though this was a follow up appointment 3 months after my original appointment. She ended up slamming the phone on me because she could not understand what I was saying nor could I understand her.
Terrible assistance, doctors not that qualified. Thought that tamiflu was only used to relieve symptoms and I had to go to another doctor to find out that tamiflu is an antiviral.
The doctors are all polite, efficient, and caring; however, the receptionists at the front are quite rude and disrespectful which ruined the whole experience for me.
Receptionists are horrible. Particularly one, is Rude and abrasive.
Very poor etiquette.  Not helpful at all, when my mom called in to book an appointment, they yelled at her.
Poor customer service. They do not respond to your questions. The doctors and staff are quite snobby in my opinion. Even the receptionist could not provide any assistance.
Bad attitude, dont take any walkin or appointment. And dont provide any alternative options.
Receptionist was very unkind and low English speaking only talk with words.
Incompetent doctor.
The attitude of the front desk is so bad that it explodes. I am not a doctor, what do you expect. The receptionist is very unprofessional and bad attitude.
reviews.review_translated_text: the receptionist is very unprofessional and bad attitude.
